help.text: CloudFormation rules help you improve the code quality of your CloudFormation templates.

help.text: Duplicate code is a rule type that helps you improve your code quality by detecting duplicated code that could be consolidated for better code maintainability.

help.text: Code maintenance rules are meant to improve your code quality by detecting code complexities or any characteristic in your source code that makes the code difficult to maintain over time.

help.text: Concurrency rules help you improve your code quality by detecting missing synchronization resulting in incorrect functionality or excessive synchronization leading to performance issues.

message.text:
This looks like an AWS access key.
Don’t embed access keys directly into code. Instead, use the AWS SDK or AWS Command Line Tools to store access keys in a secure location that can be referenced by your code. If an access key is in your code then it could have leaked. Therefore we recommend that you rotate your credentials as soon as possible. Learn more about [Best Practices for Managing AWS Access Keys](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html).

**Problem:** This code contains a potential information leakage in the handling of AWS access secrets.

**Fix:** Consider using IAM roles instead of fixed secrets for IAM users. If you must use IAM users, consider securing access secrets outside your code.

More information: Learn about [hard-coded secrets](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/798.html) and [best practices in securing AWS access secrets](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html).
